credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Tabernacle
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Vertical rectangle. Below are the moldings of the altar furniture. The tabernacle has the shape of a building. Seen from its left corner. Below is a dado. The central part is bordered by a convex semi-circle with six free columns and a cupola. Inside is a group of figures. The lateral panels contain a niche with a statue. Above the upper entablature are on either side two figures, in the center are two angels upon clouds, in adoration of a central motif.
name: Drawing
